FuncDef: This parameter customizes the throttling of OSPF LSA-generation. Timers that determine when to generate the first, second, and subsequent LSAs can be controlled with this command. Subsequent LSAs are generated at increasing intervals of thelsa-second-waittimer until a maximum value is reached.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the maximum interval, in milliseconds, between two consecutive occurrences of an LSA being generated. Values-10 to 600000. ParamDefault: Default- 5000

Specifies the first waiting period between link-state advertisements (LSA) originate(s), in milliseconds. When the LSA exceeds the lsa-initial-wait timer value and the topology changes, there is no wait period and the LSA is immediately generated. Values-10 to 600000. ParamDefault: Default- 5000

Specifies the hold time in milliseconds between the first and second LSA generation. The next topology change is subject to this second wait period. With each subsequent topology change, the wait time doubles (this is 2x the previous wait time). This assumes that each failure occurs within the relevant wait period. Values-10 to 600000. ParamDefault: Default- 5000
